title: Dont’t venture in to sea; Warning to Fishermen
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Department of Meteorology announced that the low level disturbance located in the Southwest Bay of Bengal has developed in to a low pressure area and lay centered over the Central parts of Southwest Bay of Bengal.
It’s likely to move east-northeast wards towards Andaman Sea during next 24hours and further developed.
Further, it said that there can be very heavy showers or thundershowers, strong winds (40-50) kmph gusting up to 60kmph associated with very rough seas over the aforementioned sea areas.
Naval and fishing communities are advised not to venture into the Central parts of southwest Bay of Bengal sea area bounded by 03S-05N and 81E-93E until further notice.
Fishing and naval community are requested to be attentive to future forecasts issued in this regard.
New Zealand borders to reopen from next month, PM Ardern says
